Body: Description: Tar and GZ extensions or file types are not blocking on Ubuntu system.

What We've Learned Updated: 1) What is the impact of the issue on your business?
-  This issue affects data security and compliance as restricted files can be transferred despite policies, It poses a risk of unauthorized data exposure.

2) Who is affected by this issue?
- User on Linux machine where the DLP agent is installed.

4) Have you attempted any troubleshooting steps yet? If so, what have you tried?
-  1) Verified the DLP policy configuration to ensure file types are correctly restricted.
   2) Restarted the DLP agent service.
   3) Checked logs for any errors or skipped rules.

5) What are you trying to do or accomplish?
- Ensure that restricted file types are blocked as per the policy to maintain security compliance.

6) When did this issue start?
- From Yesterday after the deployment on one of Linux Operating system.

7) Can you please let us know the Client, Server, OS version on which the situation is encountered?
-  Client OS: Linux Ubuntu 22.04;5.19.0-32-generic;x86_64
   Client Agent Version : 2.4.4.1 - (Linux)

8) On what platform is your Endpoint Protector hosted? (on-prem, AWS, Google cloud platform, Azure, Hosted by EPP on AWS)
- Hosted By CoSoSys.

9) Screen shots, logs, other artifacts, etc.
- Attached the log screenshot.
Next Steps Updated: - the customer agreed to create a collect logs during the mentioned event and to send them to us
